paragraph.heading: 1HTML Report Project Wizard
paragraph.paragraph: This wizard will generate the requested HTML documentation for all or part of you compiled ENViSioN! project.
paragraph.heading: 2Page content
paragraph.paragraph: The wizard comprises of the following pages:

list.item: Introduction Page - Introducing the wizard and its requirements
Select ENViSioN! Project - The compiled ENViSioN! to document
Choose Clusters - Select the clusters to generate documentation for
Summary - The summary of the wizard, and what happens next

paragraph.heading: 2Requirements
paragraph.paragraph:
The HTML Report Wizard requires that you use a compiled ENViSioN! project. For the best results ensure that you compile in the release configuration mode, or a configurationmode that has the '
/10_Developing\20_Managing_Projects\10_Configuring_A_Project\10_Project_Property_Pages\GeneralPage.htm#OptimizeCode
Optimize Code
' project property set in the
/10_Developing\20_Managing_Projects\10_Configuring_A_Project\10_Project_Property_Pages\GeneralPage.xml Genera l properties.
paragraph.heading: 2HTML Report Wizard Overview
paragraph.paragraph: The HTML Report Wizard will generate a set of HTML documents corresponding to the selected clusters you wish to document. A Table of Contents (TOC) will also begenerated with these files.
paragraph.heading: 2Eiffel ENViSioN Project Selection
paragraph.paragraph: The first page of the wizard asks for a compiled ENViSioN! project to generated the HTML documentation for. Simple enter the path compiled Eiffel Project File (*.epr)located in the relevant configuration directory of your project directory, or use the provided browse button.
paragraph.heading: 2 Clusters Selection
paragraph.paragraph: You may generate documentation for all or a subset of the clusters in your Project. The Clusters To Generate page allows you to select the project clusters containing thoseclasses to generate the documentation for.

The 'Excluded Clusters' list is the list of clusters that will not have documentation generated for them and the 'Included Clusters' list will. You can include/exclude clusters using one of thefour selection buttons ' <<', ' <', '>' or '>>'.

list.item: '<' will exclude only those selected clusters in the Included Clusters list.
'>' will include only those selected clusters in the Excluded Clusters list.
'>>' will include all of the clusters.
